content.raw:
I also just ran into trouble with the joint_control tutorial with the error message given below. It has trouble finding the ros package "joint_state_publisher" referenced in drcsim/ros/drc_robot_utils/manifest.xml

I'm running a fresh install according to the installation instructions, and I don't seem to have that ros package. The tutorial seems to work if the line containing "<depend package="joint_state_publisher"/>" is commented out of manifest.xml

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/scpeters/ros/joint_control_tutorial/scripts/joint_control.py", line 3, in <module>
    import roslib; roslib.load_manifest('joint_control_tutorial')
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/roslib/launcher.py", line 62, in load_manifest
    sys.path = _generate_python_path(package_name, _rospack) + sys.path
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/roslib/launcher.py", line 98, in _generate_python_path
    packages = get_depends(pkg, rospack) 
  File "/opt/ros/fuerte/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/roslib/launcher.py", line 51, in get_depends
    vals = rospack.get_depends(package, implicit=True)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 186, in get_depends
    s.update(self.get_depends(p, implicit))
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 186, in get_depends
    s.update(self.get_depends(p, implicit))
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 180, in get_depends
    names = [p.name for p in self.get_manifest(name).depends]
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 118, in get_manifest
    return self._load_manifest(name)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 157, in _load_manifest
    retval = self._manifests[name] = parse_manifest_file(self.get_path(name), self._manifest_name)
  File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 149, in get_path
    raise ResourceNotFound(name, ros_paths=self._ros_paths)
rospkg.common.ResourceNotFound: joint_state_publisher
ROS path [0]=/opt/ros/fuerte/share/ros
ROS path [1]=~/ros
ROS path [2]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/ros
ROS path [3]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/fire_hose
ROS path [4]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/drc_robot
ROS path [5]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/drc_terrain
ROS path [6]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/low_poly_golf_cart
ROS path [7]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/camhand
ROS path [8]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/standpipe
ROS path [9]=/opt/ros/fuerte/share
ROS path [10]=/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks
content.html:
I also just ran into trouble with the joint_control tutorial with the error message given below. It has trouble finding the ros package "joint_state_publisher" referenced in drcsim/ros/drc_robot_utils/manifest.xml

I'm running a fresh install according to the installation instructions, and I don't seem to have that ros package. The tutorial seems to work if the line containing "<depend package="joint_state_publisher"/>" is commented out of manifest.xml

Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/scpeters/ros/joint_control_tutorial/scripts/joint_control.py", line 3, in <module> import roslib; roslib.load_manifest('joint_control_tutorial') File "/opt/ros/fuerte/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/roslib/launcher.py", line 62, in load_manifest sys.path = _generate_python_path(package_name, _rospack) + sys.path File "/opt/ros/fuerte/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/roslib/launcher.py", line 98, in _generate_python_path packages = get_depends(pkg, rospack) File "/opt/ros/fuerte/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/roslib/launcher.py", line 51, in get_depends vals = rospack.get_depends(package, implicit=True) File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 186, in get_depends s.update(self.get_depends(p, implicit)) File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 186, in get_depends s.update(self.get_depends(p, implicit)) File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 180, in get_depends names = [p.name for p in self.get_manifest(name).depends] File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 118, in get_manifest return self._load_manifest(name) File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 157, in _load_manifest retval = self._manifests[name] = parse_manifest_file(self.get_path(name), self._manifest_name) File "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/rospkg/rospack.py", line 149, in get_path raise ResourceNotFound(name, ros_paths=self._ros_paths) rospkg.common.ResourceNotFound: joint_state_publisher ROS path [0]=/opt/ros/fuerte/share/ros ROS path [1]=~/ros ROS path [2]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/ros ROS path [3]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/fire_hose ROS path [4]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/drc_robot ROS path [5]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/drc_terrain ROS path [6]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/low_poly_golf_cart ROS path [7]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/camhand ROS path [8]=/usr/share/drcsim-0.9.0/models/standpipe ROS path [9]=/opt/ros/fuerte/share ROS path [10]=/opt/ros/fuerte/stacks
